meanings.definition: To improvise or play casually on a musical instrument.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys noodling on her guitar in the evenings.
meanings.sent2: The musician was noodling on the piano before the concert.
meanings.sent3: Instead of practicing, he spent the afternoon noodling on his saxophone.
meanings.sent4: Her fingers danced across the keys, noodling out a beautiful melody.
meanings.sent5: The sound of her noodling filled the room with joy.

meanings.definition: To fish for catfish using only the hands as bait.
meanings.sent1: He went noodling in the river and caught a big catfish.
meanings.sent2: Noodling is a unique way of fishing that requires skill and bravery.
meanings.sent3: She joked that she was going noodling to catch dinner with her bare hands.
meanings.sent4: Noodling for catfish is like a thrilling underwater treasure hunt.
meanings.sent5: The tradition of noodling has been passed down for generations.

meanings.definition: To waste time or procrastinate in a lazy manner.
meanings.sent1: Instead of studying, he spent the day noodling on his phone.
meanings.sent2: She was caught noodling around when she should have been working.
meanings.sent3: He always ends up noodling when he has important tasks to complete.
meanings.sent4: Noodling around won't help you finish your project on time.
meanings.sent5: Her habit of noodling led to many missed deadlines.
